newsitem.title: NIGERIA: At least two die in Nigeria tanker blast.
newsitem.headline: At least two die in Nigeria tanker blast.

text.p: At least two crew members died when a tanker exploded and caught fire in the bay off Lagos on Friday, local newspapers reported on Saturday.
One newspaper said the death toll was as high as eight.
There has been no official word on the death toll in the explosion which sent hundreds of workers in the Nigerian city centre rushing from their offices in panic.
Navy Captain Shuaibu Amodu, the head of security at Lagos port said the explosion was caused by welding work.
He told the News Agency of Nigeria that a gas cylinder which was being used for repair works on the tanker exploded, tearing off the bow and setting the ship on fire.
London-based managers of the tanker Al Zainab said it had finished discharging a cargo of naphtha and was entering port to load provisions when the explosion occurred just before noon.
The 29,800-deadweight-ton vessel was built in 1971 and flies the flag of St Vincent and the Grenadines.
